quarks.javax.websocket

Class QuarksSslContainerProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • quarks.javax.websocket.QuarksSslContainerProvider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    QuarksSslContainerProviderImpl

    public abstract class QuarksSslContainerProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    A WebSocketContainer provider for dealing with javax.websocket SSL issues.

    • JSR356 lacks API for Client-side SSL configuration
    • Jetty's javax.websocket.ContainerProvider ignores the javax.net.ssl.keyStore system property. It correctly handles javax.net.ssl.trustStore
    see https://github.com/eclipse/jetty.project/issues/155

    The net is that Jetty's javax.websocket.ContainerProvider works fine for the "ws" protocol and for "wss" as long as one doesn't need to programatically specify a trustStore path and one doesn't to specify a keyStore for SSL client authentication support.

    A QuarksSslContainerProvider implementation is responsible for working around those limitations.

    • Method Detail

      • getSslWebSocketContainer

        public static javax.websocket.WebSocketContainer getSslWebSocketContainer(java.util.Properties config)
                                                                   throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Create a WebSocketContainer setup for SSL.

        The Java ServiceLoader is used to locate an implementation of quarks.javax.websocket.Quarks.SslContainerProvider.

        Parameters:
        config - SSL configuration info as described by quarks.containers.wsclient.javax.websocket.Jsr356WebSocketClient.
        Returns:
        the WebSocketContainer
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - upon failure

      • getSslContainer

        protected abstract javax.websocket.WebSocketContainer getSslContainer(java.util.Properties config)
        Create a WebSocketContainer setup for SSL. To be implemented by a javax.websocket client provider.
        Parameters:
        config - SSL configuration info.
        Returns:
        the WebSocketContainer
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if it fails
